channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nvidia reportedly weighs ramping up H200 production to meet surging demand in China
item.description: After successfully lobbying the Trump administration to approve the sales of its H200 chips to China, Nvidia is now thinking of adding capacity to pro...

item.title: Merriam-Webster names ‘slop’ the word of the year
item.description: AI-generated content has dominated the internet over the past year, and America's dictionary took note.

item.title: Nvidia Becomes a Major Model Maker With Nemotron 3
item.description: The world’s top chipmaker wants open source AI to succeed—perhaps because closed models increasingly run on its rivals’ silicon.

item.title: Snapchat rolls out its end-of-year Recaps
item.description: The Recap is a short video that offers a personalized look at highlights from Snaps, Stories, and Chats, showing how users connected and expressed the...

item.title: Lightspeed raises record $9B in fresh capital
item.description: The massive fund haul will allow the Silicon Valley firm to continue to invest in cash hungry AI startups.

item.title: Ford’s next F-150 Lightning will have a gas generator as it pivots away from large EVs
item.description: The company is abandoning plans for a brand new all-electric pickup truck codenamed "T3" and ending production of the battery-only Lightning.

item.title: Tesla starts testing robotaxis in Austin with no safety driver
item.description: It's one of the last big steps before the company can truly claim it's operating a robotaxi service, and start to take on Waymo.

item.title: Ford is starting a battery storage business to power data centers and the grid
item.description: Ford will invest about $2 billion into the new business over the next two years.

item.title: First Voyage raises $2.5M for its AI companion helps you build habits
item.description: First Voyage has raised $2.5 million in a seed funding round from a16z speed run, SignalFire, True Global, and other investors.

item.title: Creative Commons announces tentative support for AI ‘pay-to-crawl’ systems
item.description: The organization offered support for this idea of an AI marketplace, and suggested several guiding principles.
